thread.title: Police: Drive-by paintball gun shooters menacing Roxborough
thread.title_full: Police: Drive-by paintball gun shooters menacing Roxborough

author: Julie Shaw
title: Police: Drive-by paintball gun shooters menacing Roxborough
text:
Police: Drive-by paintball gun shooters menacing Roxborough Updated: March 9, 2017 — 3:48 PM EST 438 Share Julie Shaw Staff writer 
Julie Shaw works on the Real Time News Desk for the Inquirer and the Daily News. During her 10-plus years at both papers, she has covered the courts, crime, immigration, and census stories. More by Julie Shaw Arrow icon 
Police believe two males in their late teens are driving around the northwest section of Philadelphia shooting people with a paintball gun, police said Thursday. 
Several people have recently been wounded, two seriously, in what detectives believe is a pattern involving a shooter and an accomplice in a white minivan. 
"It's shocking," said Lt. Dan Brooks of the Northwest Detective Division. "Almost all the victims were out enjoying the nice weather, jogging, bike riding or walking. We're very concerned by it." White minivan from which someone shot a paintball gun. 
Brooks said paintball gun shootings are not new in the city. He recalled a similar pattern more than five years ago when he was in the Southwest Detective Division. 
The Northwest Detective Division is investigating these five recent reports of paintball gun attacks: 
• About 8:40 p.m. Tuesday, a 16-year-old boy was walking in the area of the 6600 block of Ridge Avenue in Roxborough when a person in a white minivan shot him in the left leg and stomach with a paintball gun. He was seriously wounded and transported to Roxborough Memorial Hospital for treatment, Brooks said. 
• Then, about 9:25 p.m. Tuesday, a 28-year-old man was in the 200 block of West Walnut Lane in Germantown when he was shot in the head with a paintball gun by someone inside a white minivan. He did not require medical treatment, police said. 
• Just after 11 p.m. Tuesday, a 44-year-old man was riding his bike near the 6000 block of Ridge Avenue in Roxborough when he was approached by a black male, who looked to be in his late teens, driving a 2001-2007 white minivan with tinted windows, police said. The victim told police that the male pulled out a paintball gun and fired it, hitting the 44-year-old man in his left eye area. This victim was seriously injured, requiring hospitalization and six stitches to his eye, Brooks said. 
• About 11:30 p.m. Tuesday, another 44-year-old man reported that he was jogging in the area of the 600 block of Wises Mill Road in Upper Roxborough when he saw a black male, who appeared to be in his late teens, inside an older white minivan with fog lights in its front bumper. The person in the minivan fired a paintball gun at the victim, striking him in the back and knocking him to the ground, police said. This victim suffered scrapes to his hands. 
• About 1:35 p.m. Wednesday, police said, a 57-year-old man was near the 8100 block of Ridge Avenue in Upper Roxborough when two black males, about 15 to 20 years old, pulled up in an older-model white minivan. One lowered the passenger-side window and shot the victim two times with a paintball gun, striking him twice in the chest, police said. This victim suffered two welts on his chest, which did not require medical attention, police said. 
Anyone with information about the paintball-gun shooter or shooters is asked to contact the Northwest Detective Division at 215-686-3353. Read more by Julie Shaw Published: March 9, 2017 — 3:48 PM EST The Philadelphia Inquirer Do you have a minute?...
